content:
```
Define the module named TopModule with input ports a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i (each 16 bits), sel (4 bits), and output port out (16 bits).

Retrieved Related Information:
a: 16-bit input signal
b: 16-bit input signal
c: 16-bit input signal
d: 16-bit input signal
e: 16-bit input signal
f: 16-bit input signal
g: 16-bit input signal
h: 16-bit input signal
i: 16-bit input signal
sel: 4-bit input signal for selecting one of the 9 inputs
out: 16-bit output signal
sel=0 chooses a
sel=1 chooses b
sel=2 chooses c
sel=3 chooses d
sel=4 chooses e
sel=5 chooses f
sel=6 chooses g
sel=7 chooses h
sel=8 chooses i
For the unused cases (sel=9 to 15), set all output bits to '1'
```
source: I would like you to implement a module named TopModule with the following interface. All input and output ports are one bit unless otherwise specified. - input  a   (16 bits) - input  b   (16 bits) - input  c   (16 bits) - input  d   (16 bits) - input  e   (16 bits) - input  f   (16 bits) - input  g   (16 bits) - input  h   (16 bits) - input  i   (16 bits) - input  sel ( 4 bits) - output out (16 bits)

content:
```
Implement the logic for the 9-to-1 multiplexer. Use the sel input to choose between inputs a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, and i. Assign the selected input to the output out.

Retrieved Related Information:
sel: 4-bit input signal for selecting one of the 9 inputs
sel=0 chooses a
sel=1 chooses b
sel=2 chooses c
sel=3 chooses d
sel=4 chooses e
sel=5 chooses f
sel=6 chooses g
sel=7 chooses h
sel=8 chooses i
For the unused cases (sel=9 to 15), set all output bits to '1'
```
source: The module should implement a 16-bit wide, 9-to-1 multiplexer. sel=0 chooses a, sel=1 chooses b, etc.

content:
```
Implement the logic for the unused cases of the multiplexer (sel=9 to 15). Set all output bits to '1' for these cases.

Retrieved Related Information:
sel: 4-bit input signal for selecting one of the 9 inputs (Type:Signal)
For the unused cases (sel=9 to 15), set all output bits to '1' (Type:StateTransition)
```
source: For the unused cases (sel=9 to 15), set all output bits to '1'.
